data.title: Filipino Food
data.text: My wife and I decided to stop in this place to eat. They serve Filipino food. The staff was friendly. The prices are very reasonable. I wasn't too impressed with the meat that I got since it was so tough. Other aspects of my food were fine and my wife also enjoyed her meal. I think otherwise if you are eating on a budget you get what you pay for.

data.title: my fiesta experience
data.text: the food was delicious and different with sublime tones of many different flavors , it was an epicurial delight

user_location.name: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

data.title: No better than the Newark Ave. location...
data.text: Restaurant with banquet/dance area behind the main but spacious  seating area...  Ordering off the main menu, even before closing time, is impossible, because they'll tell you they're out of a specific dish...  The steam table offerings didn't look or smell attractive either.  Had a combination plate with rice and two main dishes, and it looked like the food had been sitting all day, because it cooled off quickly and didn't taste good at all.  I never returned, because it seemed like the bad food handling practices there were similar to the other poorly rated restaurant on Newark Ave. in Jersey City, NJ.  Never again...

data.title: A typical filipino fast food restaurant
data.text:
This place has been here for a while.  The reason to this is the good food and the reasonable price.  For an average hardworking person who has limited funds and needs to have their belly full, this is the place for you.  If you are one of those who's head tilted so high and think you are the head "Hancho"?  Go somewhere else.  I agree that the place needs some spic and span to make it better.  But if they are keeping the price of the food this low, we cannot complain.  
If you want to relax and hang put with your buddies after work and just want to have good Filipino food.  This is your place, staff are nice to you if you talk to them off course. Please do not treat Filipino staff like the way you treat your maids at your old country.

data.title: Good food but...
data.text: Their crispy pata is worth a try and the other Filipino dishes are OK, but they have to really clean up the place.  Filipinos miss eating food from home and that is the draw of this place, but I hope that the owners strive to make the restaurant up to par with their American competition in terms of cleanliness and ambience.

data.title: Decent filipino food, messy place.

you have good food but, there's been rumours from people that the ares isn't to sanitary!

Parking around here sucks too!  you gotta circle around a few times to find metered parking.

data.title: very good filipino turo-turo, I love the fish kilawin, sisig, crispy pata, kalderang kambing, and, papaitan..hah, i...
data.text: very good filipino turo-turo, I love the fish kilawin, sisig, crispy pata, kalderang kambing, and, papaitan..hah, i need beer with these foods.

data.title: Great food, but don't go...
data.text: Great food, but don't go during when there's a party there.  They'll only have limited seating so you'll have to wait until a table frees up before being seated.
